Reviews.Title: “Don't do it - stay somewhere a little more central”
Reviews.Author: fawky
Reviews.Content: We stayed in April 2009. The hotel was fairly easy to find but not in a very nice neighbourhood. I wouldn't stay around here again. Everything was fine when we checked in. When we went to our room I thought how considerate it was that they give you earplugs (I'm a very light sleeper and sleep with earplugs at the best of times). When I opened the curtains to look out the window - BAM, train tracks! Holy cow, no wonder they give you earplugs. The trains are so noisy, there is so many tracks. We just laughed, what else could we do! The room itself was fine really. Reasonably clean and enough room with a little bar fridge to keep our water cool. There was also a little Italian restaurant just down the road (I forget the road, but it's the main road between the hotel and the Pyramide train station), opposite side of the road to the train station. It doesn't have a sign out the front, but it's run by an Italian girl and her boyfriend and mother work there. It was excellent, we went back a second night. The food was beautiful and she gave us free dessert which was a speciality and absolutely delicious, and also a free glass of wine. She was so welcoming and friendly. I wouldn't stay in the area again, but it was okay for our first time to Rome. The trains were easy to navigate and get around the city to all the sights etc from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: MBA722
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be very accomodating. It wasn't in the best location, but my son who is going to school in Rome lives a block away. Comfortable and clean, but no screens in the windows.

Reviews.Title: “Not Terrible But Not That Great Either”
Reviews.Author: theduckiest
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel over Easter weekend, last minute, and ended up paying 100 euro a night. I am SURE that you can find better hotels in Rome for that much under normal circumstances. It's very basic. Positives: - It's near the metro station. About a 10 euro cab ride from Campo Dei Fiori (where a lot of bars are). - The staff is really nice and helpful. - The beds are comfortable. - Yes, you open your window and you can see the train tracks, but the train noise actually didn't bother us that much. I can't imagine it would be a problem unless you stayed in the hotel during the day. They also give you earplugs. Negatives - - Not much of anything near the hotel. - ASK FOR A ROOM WITH A BATH. We got a "shower" room so there was a curtain and a drain in the floor, which, needless to say, means we had a flooded bathroom most of the time. - Our air conditioner made a lot of noise. - Mosquitoes (I think this would be a problem anywhere though) I mean, it was fine, I would say it was below average for a normal hotel, but it was definitely decent.

Reviews.Title: “I've already booked my next stay”
Reviews.Author: adamsfam3
Reviews.Content: My first experience with a European hotel and I was very pleased. It was clean, the staff friendly, and in a great location. 5 minutes walk from the metro and the same for the train to the airport. My travel was over the Thanksgiving holiday and I paid 74euro per night with breakfast included. There is wireless internet in the lobby and my room had Sky satellite TV. Don't forget to pick up your TV remote from the front desk. The only downside was that the beds were not very comfortable. The metro is right next door and I did know when the trains passed but it wasn't bothersome.

Reviews.Title: “roma”
Reviews.Author: jraja1
Reviews.Content: nice room, superb location, good breakfast, clean toilets, for the price it was great, except that u could hear the noise from the high speed trains coz the hotel is next 2 the train tracks couldnt sleep well coz of that theres free internet in the lobby n the staff r very nice

Reviews.Title: “if you have to stay in South Rome...”
Reviews.Author: Tonguetwister
Reviews.Content: we got stuck in southern Rome and had to find a hotel. our guidebook had no help on this area of the city. we literally walked around the metro for a couple of hours, everyone gave us bad directions until we finally asked the newspaper stand lady. (tabachi) . this place was a 3 star hotel in a bad part of town. lots of security inside. room was standard, fine. some towels were dirty. breakfast area very ugly and breakfast very skimpy. front desk very nice. it all worked out in the end, so if you have to stay south of the attractions, this would be okay. (it's close to the station you need for visiting Ostia Antica).

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT USE THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: 2Adults2KidsIreland
Reviews.Content: Do not use this hotel - they took 225 Euro from my credit card after departure that was not authorised and even after six months of seeking a refund they refuse to acknowledge that it happened despite showing them credit card statements with the unauthorised debit and the broker we used talking to them on our behalf. The broker ended up exasperated and said there was nothing more they could do - this was theft, pure and simple. Don't get caught like we did.

Reviews.Title: “Choo Choo here comes the train!”
Reviews.Author: cucullen
Reviews.Content: I cant understand how the last review FAILED to mention that the hotel is practically built on a railway line... We asked to be moved to the front of the hotel which was a bit better. The hotel is on a messy enough street and not a great area.. A double room was 125 euros,, which is overpriced for what you get. There is better value to be got in rome whether you a bit more or less... good points - the staff were friendly, the rooms were clean, its close to Testachio ans Aventine and a metro stop - Piramide...

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Primus Roma
HotelInfo.Address: Via Giovanni da Empoli 11 - 13, 00154 Rome, Italy
